intro: Camissoniopsis pallida subsp. hallii, commonly known as the pallid evening primrose, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its pale yellow, star-shaped flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically features slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as slopes and grasslands. Camissoniopsis pallida subsp. hallii is adapted to arid environments and has a unique flowering pattern that aligns with its nocturnal pollinators.
